intro: Mesembryanthemum rhodanthum, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It blooms during the summer months, producing clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
